Instrument.name: Lunar Prospector Spacecraft Electron Reflectometer
Instrument.description: The Lunar Prospector Spacecraft Electron Reflectometer (ER) instrument was based on the instrument flown on the Mars Global Surveyor spacecraft. Some changes were made to the Lunar Prospector version to account for the spinning spacecraft. The ER instrumentation consisted of a symmetric hemispherical electrostatic analyzer and an electronics box. The electronics box was common to the ER and its companion instrument, the Magnetometer (MAG). The ER had a 360 degree disk-shaped field-of-view. The electrostatic optics selected energy and focused the particles onto an imaging detector. The ER sensor was a 12 cm diameter cylinder, 9 cm high. The combined mass of the Magnetometer and Electron Reflectometer was about 5 kg, and the two instruments together used about 4.5 w of power. The Magnetometer/Electron Reflectometer (MAG/ER) experiment investigated the origin and nature of lunar crustal magnetic fields and constrained the size of a metallic core. The experiment provided global maps of the lunar crustal magnetic fields and provided estimates of the lunar induced magnetic dipole moment.
